page.title: 03Palm Sunday,Wantage. 1985.
page.content: Both priests were celebrating their first Easter in Wantage in 1985,and they decided to start Holy Week by processing from Holy Trinity (Charlton) to the Parish Church of St.Peter and St.Paul. Parishioners met in the car-park at Charlton where Father Robert Wright (Priest-in-Charge) said prayers, and and the Curate (Father Simon Evans) sprinkled holy water on them and blessed crosses made from palm leaves. Everyone then lined up and formed a procession.About 200 people walked through the town singing hymns and carrying the palm crosses.Those who could not walk so far met them at the Church. A special service was then held and it was followed by coffee.
